intro: Euphrasia santolinifolia, commonly known as the santolinifolia eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Euphrasia santolinifolia is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
